website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to entertaining felines, this well-loved track keeps the ball rolling and is large enough for group play. Stimulating fun for curious kitties.
pros: Motion-activated balls light up and zip around the track for an intriguing chase that most cats can’t resist
Spurs activity by stimulating the senses
Large design accommodates several cats at once
cons: Large paws might not fit in the gaps
Some owners felt their kitties were able to lift the top off too easily

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how much my cats love this toy. Not so much playing with it all the time but sleeping in it. Every time i walk in my kitchen there is a cat or two sleeping in the middle of this toy. I can't figure out what the fascination is with sleeping in it but all my cats do it. So to me it is worth every penny to give them a fun spot to sleep. I will post some pictures of my cats sleeping and playing in this toy.
customer_reviews.author: hm

customer_reviews.title: Countless hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: We have 6 cats. When this arrived, we easily assembled it and put it down on the floor. All 6 immediately ran in to check it out. After having had it about a month, it still gets regular play from 3-4 of our cats. What's nice is that it isn't something you have to start - they tend to self-play. I often hear the ball rolling around the track at various times of day. We purchased an additional ball and have 2 of them on the track. We also added the cat grass addition recently. (It's also been well received.) I think if you have energetic cats who like to play - this will work well for you!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie DeSimone

customer_reviews.title: The best cat toy ever....
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually leave reviews, but I have to with this product. I have two cats and I buy them toys once in a while. They play with it at first and then not so much interested. I have two cats with different tastes in toys. Both of my cats can not stop playing with this on a daily basis. This has been going on for 2 months. In fact one of my cats will play, fall asleep on it, wake up and start playing again. This has been the best purchase I ever made for my cats. This is even better than catnip. A must toy for every cat!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Looks like fun, but my cats are too big.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it looks like fun, and I'm sure it is -- that is, if your cats are the right size. I have large Himalayans so their paws are too big to fit in the spaces to push the ball. If you have average to smaller cats, or kittens, it would work well.
customer_reviews.author: tented

customer_reviews.title: For smaller cats and kittens ONLY! Unable to return product.
customer_reviews.text: Beware when buying this product. The slots where the cats insert their paws are only large enough for smaller cats or kittens. My cat is about 14 lbs and he couldn't get his paws into the slots to play with the ball. So he eventually gave up. That in and of itself is not the reason I gave this such a bad review. I was simply going to pack it back up and return it, paying whatever shipping/restocking fees might be associated with that. No problem, I get it. However, upon disassembling it, the blue transparent covers are permanently locked into place. As careful as I tried to be, I ended up breaking the thing. Now it can't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: J-Ko

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Dogs and Cats!
customer_reviews.text: Very fun product. My sister ordered it for her cat but I tried it out with my dog who is a Schipperke and she also loved it. But you can see at the end of the video that she figures out how to take off the top and steal the ball. Her cats have not done that and have lots of fun with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Kitten approved!
customer_reviews.text: After some encouragement, my older kitten enjoyed playing with this. But within a couple of minutes had popped the cover to the tracks and got the ball out and ran it around the house until it was nearly lost forever. I then put some packing tape to secure the plastic tops and some sturdy string on one (so I could remove it if need be), otherwise you, too, will spend some time looking for the ball. I got this because my kitten was getting bored with foil balls and mouse on a string toys. And she likes it. I even heard her using it in the middle of the night. Kitten approved!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer679

customer_reviews.title: Dont rate crap bad just cause a picky kitty does not like ...
customer_reviews.text: Dont rate crap bad just cause a picky kitty does not like it! It's still a quality well built toy that my cat happen to immediately fall in love with. It's well priced enough to be worth giving it a try with your kitty cause if they like it they will get get all the money worth out of it with hours of bopping the ball back and forth down the track.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Diamond

customer_reviews.title: MY CATS LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are 7 years old, trim, but do not like to play still. My female cat his over grooming and I read the best way to combat that is keep her busy - BOY IS SHE BUSY. She is very adept with her paws (no claws) and can shove that ball from one end to the other. The boy cat is not so good with his motor skills, so he just picks it up with his teeth and then blocks the ball as it comes around. it is hysterical to watch. My ball however is starting to dim and I need to buy new balls, I am searching for those now. Great toy - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. New Mexico

customer_reviews.title: Cat LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to try and wake me up really early every morning to play now I can hear him playing with this all of the time so that I can go back to sleep lol. Some people complain that the top blue section comes off and the ball is easily lost which was also an issue I had untill I looked closer and found you are supposed to slide the top piece forward to lock into place. So I really have no complaints about this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Camille Yeates

customer_reviews.title: Great toy if your kitty is super playful.
customer_reviews.text: It really is a great toy. The ball that comes with it lights up....but can be annoying because movement can make it go on. I've got to admit, my cat, who is a 2 year old once feral cat isn't interested in it. But, he has so many other toys (ALOT of mice) that he just doesn't play with it. But, I'm sure a younger cat, perhaps a kitten would love it. Leo being former outdoor kitty plays a little with it but not much. But, it's a great toy for a kitty who has always been an indoor kitty.
customer_reviews.author: TazCC

customer_reviews.title: Missing Ball & Instructions...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these, one for my cats and one for my friend's cat. One of the boxes had no instructions (not that you need them) and no ball. The other box had everything in it. Since it is just days away from Christmas, it will be too late to try and return mine. So now I have to go shop for a ball that will fit this track. It is disappointing to purchase a product that has missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Candies32

customer_reviews.title: Only really fun for the cat if the ball lights up
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved this. For the first week. Then the ball battery died because even though it is only supposed to light up when being played with, it would light up even when not being played with. It gave me and my husband quite a shock when walking into a dark room and seeing a bright red flashing light in the middle of the night. This is too expensive to only last for a week. I should have sent it back, but time gets past you and then it is too late.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cats, alas
customer_reviews.text: Well, let's see. It's a great product... if your cat isn't a good puzzle-solver. Once our cats discovered that it just "did the same thing" over and over (like those automated wand toys, and rotating laser pointers)? They were done. Over. Bored. Ball goes around. Bored. Bored bored bored cats. Bored. That said, the product isn't to blame. The neighbor's cats adore this thing, and will bat a ball around and around the track for 20 minutes, she said. At 4 AM. A few days a week. My cats played with it twice and yawned. Snapping it together/apart was a pain, and my cats' disinterest was epic, but the neighbor says it's enduring well, so cred for that!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY Toy Needed
customer_reviews.text: Cat and kittens love the cat and mouse chase. The best thing about this toy, is while your away your cat will play. They swat at the ball making it roll through the up and down design. My cat lays inside keeping an eye on the ball for signs of movement. She then swats at the ball and the chase is on. She does this every day and does not ever get tired of this toy. There is another smaller version of the same type but that does not have the hills allowing the ball to roll further. There are so many possibilities. Buy more sets and have some run under tables just like a mouse would do.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Foster kittens love it!
customer_reviews.text: I recently took in three kittens to foster and needed toys. This one has been a huge hit! They’re very small and still able to easily play with this. The ball is lightweight and rolls extremely well. Putting it together was very easy and I like that it can be reconfigured into other shapes. My only complaint is that the blue part on top pops off when the cat pushes his paw under it to hit the ball. If my tiny kittens can push it loose, I’m sure adult cats could knock it off entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Beanomly

customer_reviews.title: The vet said they needed a toy...
customer_reviews.text: The grandcats were getting cranky; maybe it was moving? COVID? Their cousin cat moving in? At any rate, the vet suggested that they needed something to do, and my daughter found this. (I was skeptical, remembering how kids would play with their new toy for an hour, and that was it.) WELL! These cats adore this thing. Two months later, it is still the center of their cat universe. As other reviewers point out, it is a favorite sleeping place. Go figure. It was easy to put together and has provided hours of fun for felines and humans alike. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki B

customer_reviews.title: 1 out of 2 Agree it is their favorite toy.
customer_reviews.text: I have two boys.(Cats in case you are wondering) After 1 month of ownership... One of them could care less - but he is not very playful unless there is food involved. The other still loves it. He plays and sleeps on it. Playtime will vary from swatting the ball around the track and jumping to get better positions to laying next to it and casually tapping the ball so it goes up the hill until it rolls back to him. I like it too. I can help him push the ball and get him chasing it or play kitty ping pong passing it back and forth. Purchased one for a friends cat too.
customer_reviews.author: Jammer1138

customer_reviews.title: Not an easily blinking ball, but they like it.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the cat would hit the ball and it would just blink furiously as it whirled around the track. I actually had to smack it myself to trigger the blinking. Though, both my 17 year old and 2 year old played with this toy, but I am thinking that if it's not going to blink easily, may as well use lighter balls so it can go faster. I think tried to buy Twinkler cat balls to switch out, as those blink a lot easier to the touch and those were to fat :(. So if you try to get a better blinking ball, make sure you check the size... even slightly bigger and this ball is going nowhere.
customer_reviews.author: ECS

customer_reviews.title: Smaller openings
customer_reviews.text: This was well built and sturdy. My cat could not access the ball well and she's a short haired domestic at 8 pounds. She lost interest so I gave it to a friend with two cats. Neither would play with it. I rated it three stars because of the smaller openings and the fact that the ball light was intermittent and sometimes would not light up when rolling. This may appeal to other small cats so know that it is a well made product and easy to put together. I've donated it rather than returning so I can't provide any information on the return process.
customer_reviews.author: nobody

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The motion sensitive, illuminated ball did not move or light up at all. And my cats completely ignored the toy altogether. No replacement ball available from vendor and toy was out of stock. Got a refund and shipped back. Likely will not purchase again after restock because cats didn't care or even so much as sniff it when I put it down in front of them. So, clearly NOT the toy for them.
customer_reviews.author: N2bleu

customer_reviews.title: Well, I like it... the cats? They may come back to it...
customer_reviews.text: It went together quickly, and I connected two sets into one, as a couple of my cats are big fans of ball toys. They played with it one day, and now don’t seem to know it exists. I am not sure that they like the balls lighting up. Looks cool to me, but the light doesn’t seem to interest them. I may have more luck pulling it back apart into two toys and maybe trying a ping pong ball. I did notice that the end caps noted in the instructions are not included—so I am not sure it can be made into a single long run as the box pictures.
customer_reviews.author: GrebeWatcher

customer_reviews.title: It's a definite WINNER
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my cat Garfield for Christmas and a month later he is still playing with it. The big advantage of this over other cat toys is that he doesn't need me to turn it on for him. Garfield quickly learned that if he just swats the ball in the track once it starts flashing for him; then he swats it around the track and keeps it going. I leave the track set up in a corner of my living room and so it is available 24/7 for him....many times I'll be in the other room and hear the swoosh of the ball being pushed around the track by him.
customer_reviews.author: Augy

customer_reviews.title: Ivan the Terrible likes it.
customer_reviews.text: So I wasn't sure if our kitten would even look at this thing when I ordered it. But once I got it and put it together, it was game on. Rather simple to put together, and seems pretty sturdy. The ball lights up and makes noise. Just what you need for a rambunctious kitten who is a terror. I've found him playing with this a night, lighting up the room. He loves it, and as long as it keeps him occupied and out of trouble, I'm happy. I will be looking for some more flashing balls, as I think he will wear this one out.
customer_reviews.author: yvonne brassfield

customer_reviews.title: Pleased even though there were drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Our playful young cat loves it. It's a great concept and looks really neat. Assembly is a bit difficult: it comes with blue and white plastic curved pieces that have to be pushed together. It takes some strength to push the pieces into each other, and unfortunately one of the blue parts to the "tunnel" cracked as we were assembling it. Because of this, our clever cat can lift the broken piece up when he wants to and take the ball out. We always know when he does it because the ball is weighted and makes more noise rolling across hard floors than our other cat ball toys.
customer_reviews.author: Constance

customer_reviews.title: Not thrilled.
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool cat toy, however, I think it's more suitable for smaller cats/kittens. I have a very large domestic short hair. He is 20+ lbs. he can't get his legs/paws in far enough to really get playing with it. He's interested, it just seems like he gets frustrated. He tries to play and then just sits there and stares at it. I'll give it a week or so and see if things improve. I also wish it came with end caps instead of having to purchase them separately. They are $3 per cap so that's an extra 6 dollars plus shipping since I don't see them on amazon. That'll be just as much as the original toy! It's frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Cat toy
customer_reviews.text: Great cat toy. It,s sturdier than most all cat toys. The ball blinks red when it’s tapped a bit hard by your cat and kind of rolls on it’s own for several seconds. It lasts for awhile n then quits again until it’s tapped by cats paw. My cat loves playing with it. But she gets bored just like any other toy so I put it up for a few days and then bring it back out for a few days. It is well made and durable. I,d have to say it,s the sturdiest cat toy I have ever bought. I would highly recommend it for any cat.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Brinckmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: My cat paid attention to this for about 5 minutes after I got it put together. She's not a big cat by any means, and she couldn't get her paws into the openings to bat the ball around. She's more interested in the ball on its own than as part of the toy. I took the track apart and stored it. She just bats the ball around now.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Denson

customer_reviews.title: With TIME, they loved it
customer_reviews.text: So, I was ready to send this back. The first night we had it, my husband, the cats, and I played with this toy for a long time. Then it was totally ignored for five days straight. I was ready to return it, but my husband didn't want to give it back. Low and behold, on day six the cats played with it ON THEIR OWN for a very long time. I have it on the floor near their food area, and I'll go in to see the light flashing. I'm glad we kept it. They use it when they're in a cat-track mood.
customer_reviews.author: M'ette

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love This
customer_reviews.text: Both of my 1yr old cats love this toy. They will randomly shake their booty and attack the ball sticking their paws all the way in the tunnel to go after it. One cat will stand and look around for the ball and pounce once she sees it chasing it around and around. Downside is the ball will sometimes not stop lighting up and I have to find a spot where it will stop and hope it doesn't move until the next play session. That doesn't happen a lot. Also my male cat will occasionally intentionally try and get the tunnel covers off. He's gotten a few off. I just pop them right back on.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: Our older cat was like a kitten again when he got this. After we introduced the baby to the family he would hit the ball for her here and there but at night they have full blown battles. We also are able to call out the kitten but giving the ball a little smack. She instantly appears ready to play. The balls lose their light up pretty quick but I'm sure it is because this is used 24/7 and the cats don't seem to care that the balls don't light up anymore.
customer_reviews.author: tammy shaw

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PARTS!!
customer_reviews.text: This item came with the 2 most important pieces missing--the two end pieces. So of course, the ball would roll right out of the circuit. However, the circuit pieces didn't totally lock together well, so the circuit pathway at the bottom wasn't totally flat--the ball didn't slide through easily anyhow, kept getting stuck. A piece of junk. I always wonder if all the positive reviews are fake after such a disappointing experience. I reported it to Amazon, and they gave me a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: LifeFlow

customer_reviews.title: My Calico Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty lives this toy. She also likes to lie down and rest her hand and head on the curves. It's sturdy and easy to assemble. I only had difficulty with making the blue part click onto the white part, but my husband helped me with that part. It keeps my kitty entertained for at least 10 minutes. She walks away, and comes back for more later.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonianGirl

customer_reviews.title: Might be Awesome but my cat just ignored it
customer_reviews.text: I thought this thing looked pretty darn awesome and after reading the review I was sure my playful cat would think it was awesome too. However, he had absolutely NO interest in this toy. He wouldn't even try it, he just looked at it like it was in the way of his play area where he throws around those dang twist ties that he prefers over every other toy I have ever bought him. AND when I went to return it, the shipping was gonna cost almost as much as the actual cost of the toy, so I just ended up giving it to another friend who has cats. I'll update this review if her cats end up loving it.
customer_reviews.author: ShelterChick

customer_reviews.title: It sucks 😒
customer_reviews.text: Wow...very difficult to detach blue plastic from the bottom half...once everything was put together my 9 month old could care less..i configured the round track and the inertia was not great enough to keep the ball rolling...so it just sits there...even detached a plastic piece so the he can get a full swipe at the ball but no bueno..maybe if the back was motorized 🤷🏽‍♂️...i will be returning this
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: The Cat Poofed His Tail
customer_reviews.text: Seems as though the cat loves it. WHAT!? A CAT LIKES SOMETHING! Yes. And I am referring to the toy, NOT the box it came in, although he also likes that. My only wish was that the ball was a little more touch sensitive to have the light turn on. It turns on about 50% of the time he taps it. He has (oddly) learned (in about 5 minutes) that if he picks the track up in his mouth, when he drops it, the light will turn on. An unforeseen annoyance, but he likes it, so whatever. They toy even got him to POOF HIS TAIL! Winner.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Williams

customer_reviews.title: If my light up ball is normal function. Then this product is almost pointless
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product, my cat is still learning to play with it. The track is made well and locks together tightly. Unfortunately the light up ball is too intermittent. Causing the cat to lose interest before he gets started. It's way way to hard to get the ball to light up, sometimes I have to slam it. The cat can only get it to light up maybe one out of ten true. once lit up, it turns off almost immediately the second it stops, half the time it turns off while still rolling fast. If the light up ball functioned better I would rate it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: 96FLEX-J

customer_reviews.title: It’s a hit!
customer_reviews.text: My box came opened, and some parts were put together. Also there was no instruction sheet etc. I’m guessing mine was a returned item. Still, the track seems sturdy and the balls light brightly ( so brightly my dog feels the need to bark at it). The hills make this track even more fun for the kitten who already enjoyed the flat version, she was able to remove the blue covers from the flat track. These seem to fit more securely. It’s a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this toy!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats--a mother and son duo--who love this toy. I bought it because now that I am teleworking, i needed something to occupy them while I work even though it's highly tempting to play with them all day. This toy is sturdy! One of my cats actually picked i up with his teeth and turned it upside down in an effort to capture the green ball. Best buy ever in the way of cat toys! I tried to upload the video but couldn't get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: rmscalia

customer_reviews.title: Best & most affordable toy I should have purchased years ago
customer_reviews.text: I foster kittens, and have tried just about every toy that exists. The favorite for every kitten is surely the pet stages ball-rolling tower, so I relied on that guy for years.. until a friend convinced me that this is way better. Holy cow was she right. This toy has provided endless entertainment for two very active kitties - and just when I think they're "over" it, they start banging the ball around again. Nice that it can be broken down to store when not needed, and extra bonus that it's easy to clean when broken down. Four very enthusiastic paws up! [from two kitties]
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: you have to put it together
customer_reviews.text: finding what fits is okay but once you get the pieces in the right places a cinch to put together My cat likes it and she plays with it for something to do but we also play with it with her I like how the ball lights up and at first it is lit most of the time but it lights up when you knock it around the batteries are fine so far but I know you can replace the lit balls. It has been 3 weeks since Christmas when my cat got this and I am pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: saw2e3

customer_reviews.title: Consider instead the SuperCircuit 2.0 for a little more money.
customer_reviews.text: Just received and set up the Circuit. Easy to set up, but it doesn't come with endcaps, so the configurations are limited. I will have to order those separately. That's why I suggest looking at the 2.0 instead before you buy. In any event, all four cats were curious at first and now it's the two girls who have continued playing with it. I will experiment with different locations to see if the two boys will start playing too.
customer_reviews.author: CatetheCat

customer_reviews.title: Won't Work For Big Cats!!!!
customer_reviews.text: In theory this is an amazing toy. The 'hills' along the track make the ball move in really interesting ways which keeps the cats' attention. HOWEVER, the holes in the blue plastic that allow the cats to bat the ball are RIDICULOUSLY small! I have two adult Siamese cats and they couldn't fit their paws in - needless to say they were incredibly frustrated and cannot play with the toy. Such a bummer and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: gmowery15

customer_reviews.title: Very popular with the kitten
customer_reviews.text: It's a little unintuitive to assemble the first time you put it together, but once you've got it together, you won't need to go though it again. My kitten LOVES this. She's now big enough to begin pulling the blue pieces of plastic off to get the ball out of the track, but she can't properly grip the ball so she spends ages wrestling with it and chasing it around because it's so slippery. The blue pieces do pop out easily sometimes but aren't harmful to cats and are easily put back in.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Day Ever
customer_reviews.text: My two cats absolutely love this toy. One of them is the brawn: he has a blast batting the ball around the track. When it comes to rest and stops flashing, he attacks and off it goes again. He'll do this for hours. The other cat is the brains of the pair. He watched the proceedings intently for awhile and then figured out that getting the ball would require ripping the track cover open with his teeth and claws. He gives it his best, but the toy withstands his efforts. All in all, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: EMF

customer_reviews.title: Not for big cat paws
customer_reviews.text: This was a very well-made toy. However, my 5-month-old Maine Coons' paws were already too big to be able to push the ball in the tunnel so they lost interest. It was easy to assemble and seemed sturdy. I can't speak to its durability. I'm rating this toy high because I can't see penalizing a product just because it didn't work for my kittens who happen to be a breed with big paws. I returned it since we couldn't use it.
customer_reviews.author: edelweiss

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Although my cat is large and too big for it, he still loves it. He bats the ball and sometimes it lights up and he tries to catch it. He is over 20 lbs and tries to reach the ball when it goes around the track. His paw and arm are too large but he tries any way!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Barbe

customer_reviews.title: Great design but had to return it
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, durable toy. However, the pieces that come to you in this particular item do not create the track as pictured or advertised. The shapes and sizes only allow you to create two medium circles. Additionally, there was a small fabric ball included, rather than the light up ball as advertised. It deserves 5 stars from a concept and design perspective = but 3 stars for the actual product.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Must-have! My little one can't stop playing it!
customer_reviews.text: It's a magic toy. My bigger one is normally very chill about toys, but even he played the roller toy for a long time. My little one just can't stop playing it! Day after day, morning or night, you hear her running around the track and rolling the ball inside. It's a great investment in my cats' joy. And I can tell from the excellent quality that the product my cats' joy has many more years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Boyang Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Not for a Grown Kitty
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea, however the holes to access the ball seems only fit for a Kitten and are simply too small for any grown kitty paw to get the ball. They are way too small for a grown cat to access the ball. I can't return mine as I tripped on it in the dark and broke some tabs. It basically useless at this point but I may try removing all of the tunnels to see if our cat likes that. This product needs a re-design or to be more specific that it's only for very small kittens. Or- use the round track method where the ball is inset and ditch the tunnels altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I pulled the tab for the ball, and the light never came on.. disappointed. Update: the light is on, but my cat has to forcefully hit the ball to get it to light up (making her work extra hard) instead of allowing her to free easy with this fun little game. I wish the creater made the balls "sensitive to touch" meaning.. as soon as your cat touches the ball, the ball will instantly light up! The way it is now, she has to work hard 😕. It has her interest now.. I'll see for how long.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and the cats!!!! They are going on four hours of nonstop playing. We have 3 cats. One is a kitten and two are almost 5. They love it. We have two round tracks that get a lot of play so I was pretty sure that this would also be a winner. When they finally stopped playing with it, the kitten fell asleep right next to it. The two older cats perched on the ottoman to make sure it didn’t go anywhere. Pics: Black cat is Pea Pod. Orange cat is Buzz (#dailybuzz) and the grey and white kitten is Wally.
customer_reviews.author: Mpls Liz

customer_reviews.title: No!!  Tiny cat destroyed this in 5 minutes...
customer_reviews.text: How about my cat ripped this apart in less than 5 minutes and promptly lost the ball.... the little things that clip in hold it together snapped right off!! My cat weighs 4 pounds y'all she should not have been able to RIP the cover off this toy.. complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Keri Ross

customer_reviews.title: Overall good
customer_reviews.text: My cats seem to like this product. They don't play with it very long. My only negative would be mine seemed to be missing the end pieces where you can make this product one straight line. The instructions have a parts list and the end pieces were listed but there were none in the box. I should have called the manufacture to get them as replacement pieces, but they have regular business hours and I am working during those hours.
customer_reviews.author: Elise Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Harder to take apart than put together, so to make sure you have it the way you want.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been trying to find a toy that my active hunter cat would like, without me.. this is great! Quiet enough we don’t notice it when she’s playing at night... the only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is the holes are a bit small... I ended up taking into my shop and making them larger. I also scalloped the ends a bit larger. Now she can get her paws into it without hurting herself. Yes, I know, but I have Maine Coons, and on top of it, one is polydactyl, so she had trouble when it was smaller. I actually bought more, and made a track under furniture for her to scramble among.
customer_reviews.author: RoboticsNut

customer_reviews.title: he/she will love this as well
customer_reviews.text: This toy has kept my ADD cat most interested (other than the laser pointer)! He loves the way the ball lights up when moved. I'm guessing if your cat loves the laser pointer, he/she will love this as well. My cat actually plays with this on his own, which is highly unusual for him. The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is because the tunnels don't stay attached very well and we constantly have to keep reattaching them to the base. We've had to buy an extra package of the balls because our cat has managed to get the ball out once the tunnel was easily removed. Other than that, this is a great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Ed and Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Must Have! Awesome Interaction!
customer_reviews.text: Our little lady kitten loves her new toy!!! She got super excited and forgot about 2 other toys that arrived in same time but were opened first. It is challenging and interactive enough for her to exercise and use logic on how to chase a twinkle light. She came back to it few times during our evening which makes me confident it will keep her interested. Spaces in the toy are comfortably large for kitten's paws, and paws are not getting jammed even if she stucks her full arm into them. It was risky for us get a largest toy from its series, but I think we could do any better than this one. The Win!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Polo

customer_reviews.title: Ball does not light up - battery is dead
customer_reviews.text: Ball does not light up or when it does it’s very light as if the battery is about dead. Very disappointed. Am trying to decide whether to go through the hassle of exchanging it - reaching out to the manufacturer for a solution. Reached out to support. To date no response.
customer_reviews.author: K P from NC

customer_reviews.title: very fun for cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it and started to play with it before it was even put together. Goes together pretty easily and no issues at all. Some reviewers said the pieces were loose; I did not have that issue at all. Some snap in and some have to slide to lock. Sometimes the ball doesn't light up, but the cats still play with it. My cats are ages 2, 3, and 4. They all enjoy it. One of my cats is a polydactyl and he is still able to use is paws or nose to move the ball.
customer_reviews.author: miarainie

customer_reviews.title: Was entertaining for me.
customer_reviews.text: The ball wouldn't work when I received this. Good thing I had ordered extra. I suggest getting the one that you can replace the batteries yourself because the one that comes with it you cannot. My cat played with it for about a week & now has no interest in it. He's about 9 months old & a little on the crazy side too. But I have 4 kittens that are 8 weeks old who will soon enjoy it soon, I'm sure. I really liked the product myself & enjoyed watching my baby play with it when he did. I would recommend trying it. It was worth the price to me just to watch him.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: My adult cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this since my cat is fully grown and it takes a little more to entertain her, but she actually really loves this toy. I do have to sit with her and help her move the ball to get her into playing but it was totally worth it. Overall the quality of the product is sturdy and putting it together wasn't that hard. Would recommend to any cat owner.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it. Pretty easy to assemble. Only comes with one ball so we purchased the additional 2-pk of balls. We've put two balls in the circuit & have had it for about two months and one of the balls has stopped glowing. Solves the problem of loosing toy balls under furniture all the time, but you cannot replace the battery in these balls, only buy new ones. Just to clear up some confusion- there is no electrical power to the circuit, the balls go around the track as the cat pushes the ball. We have two cats and they tend to sit at opposite ends and push the balls back and forth to each other.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fits w/ other toys
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to play with this, and I was happy to find that the 'Petstages' cat toy I have fits perfectly in one of the rings, and also fits the spare light up play balls I purchased. This toy is kind of big, but easily stays out of the way, and stays put. I would recommend getting the spare balls because they can be used separately & also fit some other toys, as mentioned. I also recommend the packing box/ material as a fun cat toy! (cats agree)!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even though ball isn't working.....
customer_reviews.text: my cat LOVES it. I have contacted company for replacement ball. My kitty has been playing with it since it got put together. He just keeps chasing ball and when it stops rolling he follows around track until he finds it. Can't wait to see once ball works! I find it to be sturdy, easy to put together and a great size. Will be ordering more Catit things to stimulate his senses!
customer_reviews.author: Shouldaboughtstock

customer_reviews.title: My Cat plays with This!
customer_reviews.text: The unit assembles easily and the white track is perfectly smooth - the ball rolls easily without any "hiccups". The blue covers, which come in two styles, must be securely pushed into place or the cat will remove them. My cat likes the toy and plays with it 2 or 3 times a day. If your cat likes the ball in the blue round track, he might very like this one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Not Build Tough Enough
customer_reviews.text: I have a one year old that loves to play with these things. I have one that is round with the ball in a grove...which is perfect, but then I saw this and the open areas for paws and the light up ball enticed me to purchase. HOWEVER, the blue "tunnels" come off easily and we are forever having to put them back into place. You would think they would POP into their groves and stay put, but they don't. Feeling sad, but he still enjoys it with our help.
customer_reviews.author: April Hutson

customer_reviews.title: Good toy
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that loves these types of toys. We had a smaller version of this product and decided we wanted to get something a little bigger. I had to take a few stars off because it doesn't hold together that great. She was able to unhook the pieces and get the ball out probably within 15 mins of playing with it. I kept having to snap the pieces back in.
customer_reviews.author: christy canaday

customer_reviews.title: Cat-astrophe
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Cat-It product my cats and I did not like. Easy to understand why: We did not find that the "Motion-activated illuminated ball lights up and zips around inside the track like a crazy roller coaster." Our ball just sat inside the track, and no amount of gently pushing it to send it around the track worked. Boo! Hisss!
customer_reviews.author: Cait

customer_reviews.title: We love this!  Well done!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our kittens LOVE this so much, I purchased a 2nd unit that configures into different shapes, as that unit has "end caps" rather than requiring it circle back to itself to close off. I highly recommended purchasing the extra balls - two to a package - as those light up when rolled and the additional balls allows multiple cats to play at the same time. The pieces snap on easily but securely, with all top pieces fitting any / all bottom pieces. Well done!!!
customer_reviews.author: GrammaC in NC

customer_reviews.title: Love to watch my little tabby play
customer_reviews.text: If you have a kitty that loves to hunt and play this is for you. My 2 year old tabby loves this. She self motivates to play and comes back to it throughout the day and night. I definitely recommend it if you have a playful kitty. My 2 year old siamese looks at it and walks away. He is an indoor outdoor cat so he gets his stimuli elsewhere. I do wish the light on the ball stayed on a little longer when sitting still, but still is a wonderful toy. Seems sturdy also!
customer_reviews.author: Scary

customer_reviews.title: The cat said 'meh'
customer_reviews.text: My cat only played with it a few times by herself. Maybe my cat is dumb. Though she doesn't play with it by herself, I sometimes have used it to play with my cat. I put some feather or something else inside and pull it around with a string or something and she plays with me like that. But she doesn't really go for the whole light-up ball thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kendi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This toy has been amazing! I purchased several years ago for our first family cat after seeing at a friends house. Her cat loved it and I hoped that my cat would as well. He absolutely did! Now, several years later we have added two beautiful little girls to our family and they now love it as well. They even play with it along side their older brother. I am terrible at writing reviews but after watching them play with this for what seemed like an hour this morning I figured it really deserved a great review!
customer_reviews.author: MrsMstry

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! And so much fun for my cat
customer_reviews.text: This is great, you have to make sure that at the edges it has a bump for the ball to go through, but it only goes together one way. And my cat that is almost a year old couldn’t wait for me to put it down! She loves it and plays with it whenever and at anytime! The ball lights up by motion so it has a long battery life! And the ball cannot come out which is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love this toy....
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love this. They have played with this more than any toy we have ever purchased. Our more sedentary cat even loves this and I am happy to say he spends time with this every day. We even hear them playing in the middle of the night. I am so thankful I ran across this. Our one cat is about 16 lbs and it has withstood his pounding.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Moore

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months my cats still play with this ball maze. Being able to vary the highs and lows as their interest flags seems to peak it again. At less than $15 U S dollars it was a good value. It is somewhat difficult to disassemble and reassemble but I believe it is necessary to keep the track functioning in good condition for cat play.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Customer

customer_reviews.title: A your cat as small as those pictured and will never get larger?
customer_reviews.text: Came missing the end pieces and a dead ball battery. It doesn't matter though. The spaces in the track are so small that only the smallest of cats could possibly play with it. My cats just stare at it. I even put some catnip on it. Eh. Whatever. It was cheap. They do like the wellness add-on/accompanying station thing.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Fulkerson

customer_reviews.title: Cat prefers box it came in vs actual toy
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited after all the reviews, I was hoping my new cat would play with my other cat with this toy after reading that this was a good co-op toy, but he really only cares for the box lol I think it's great (if your cat likes this sort of thing) seems like good quality but I think it needs more flat tracks - also doesn't come with the track ender pieces. I bought two sets to use the flat tracks as I thought he was disinterested because he had a hard time rolling the ball up the hill, but nope :') oh well
customer_reviews.author: Spicy

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: I have two kittens and they still have not lost interest. It's not their first toy of choice (they like the handheld laser better) but it's been amazing to me that they still play with it even after two months. What helped was having more than one ball in the loop. And it also helps to have the balls light up. They seem to like the combination of the balls flashing lights and the noise of the balls hitting each other. I would say the only improvement you need is to supply more than one ball. Luckily, you can buy more lighted balls on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Humble Consumer

customer_reviews.title: From kitten to cat, still enjoyed.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my kitten when she was 2 months old and my dog played with it more than she did for a while. Then she went through her crazy stage and this toy definitely got the brunt of her energy. And even as an adult now, she will sit in her toy and take a few playful swipes at the ball, which is still blinking. The dog doesn't play with it anymore. Either way, this was well worth the cost and will stay on the floor awaiting my cat's attentions.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Something is missing.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice toy, but unfortunately the ball can't really be seen (even by me) unless it is lighting up and moving. I tried it with both my foster kittens and my adult cats. Once the balls stops rolling and the light goes out, they loose sight of the ball and they are done. I don't know if the exterior of the ball comes in different colors, but even I have a hard time finding the idol ball because it just blends in with the track.
customer_reviews.author: slynnc

customer_reviews.title: Best toy EVER!
customer_reviews.text: IMO this is the best toy EVER! Plenty of motion, engaging but not annoying sound, multiple cats can play as well as singles, and I can play or sit it out, NO BATTERIES NEEDED. i have probably bought 8 of these or more... for my housecats, for foster cats and as gifts for other cat lovers. Priced very reasonably, too.
customer_reviews.author: raggmopp

customer_reviews.title: My cats don't like it....
customer_reviews.text: But my dogs love/want to eat it haha plus it's cool to roll the ball and the cats will get somewhat interested when someone else is playing with it. Fairly easy to put together, but hard to take apart. So, make sure you are doing it correctly the first time around hahaha!! Anyway, we're gonna keep it, it's pretty cool and inexpensive :))
customer_reviews.author: offFAM

customer_reviews.title: My cat loved this!  Until the treat tower...
customer_reviews.text: This track was hours of entertainment for my young cat. The add-ons were more mixed but the track was easy to keep him playing. It's fairly expensive for the hours of pleasure though. It was passed along. This product held up nicely to the play. It stays in place with carpet but moves around on hard floors - though not too bad considering. It was entertaining for me to watch as well. The cat would come back to it off and on but mostly needed to be prompted to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Maish

customer_reviews.title: Kitties LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of teenage kitties who play with this daily -- Taking turns, playing together and sleeping inside the the loop(s) of the 8 -- The biggest issue is that the top pieces easily come unfixed allowing kitties to remove the lighted ball from the track -- Without the ball, there is no toy -- BUT if you can managed to keep the tops secured over the track you're in business -- HIGHLY recommend for kitty fun :)
customer_reviews.author: Meanne

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: All of my cats enjoyed this toy. The only complaint I have is the instructions weren’t very helpful, but I figured it out easily. Kept my kittens entertained for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Miroballi

customer_reviews.title: So far 1 out 3 love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats. I bought this for my kitten who is not even a year old yet. He has a lot of energy and other toys only held his attention for a few minutes. He Is the most interested in it. One of my other cat will sit near by and watch. The oldest is not even interested. I am still giving this toy 5 stars because it holds the attention of the cat I wanted it to. I will update if any of my other cats start to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: MrsP358

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken ball and never got responese
customer_reviews.text: It arrived late and the balls only glowed for 6 tries and never lit up again. Out of 5 playful breeds of cats only my youngest sphynx would play with it . Tried contacting them for replacement ball might as well have to speak another language they dont respond. My raccoons baby likes it only reason I didnt open return
customer_reviews.author: Meadow Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment!!! Worth every cent!
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves it! First thing she does is play with it in the morning when she gets up. Spends hours playing with it. Only complaint is the parts are hard to snap in and one of the tunnels broke almost Immediately when trying to snap into place cause was so hard to snap in place. Luckily, this didn't detract from the enjoyment of the toy as the extra open space due to lack of this tunnel piece actually "heightened" my cat's excitement in being able to see the ball roll through there. She was able to slide her paw in but still couldn't lift the ball off its track. Highly reccomend.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: A little too small for my cats but good customer service
customer_reviews.text: The toy is a little too small for my 2-year-old cats, and it's not very solid. My cats are pretty violent and the toy doesn't seem to stand their attack. When I first received it, there's no ball in it, and the Q&A is incorrect (Q&A said there are 2 balls, but the toy only comes with 1.) I'd have given a lower rating but their customer service is very nice for sending me the missing ball immediately.
customer_reviews.author: YC

customer_reviews.title: fun toy for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes to play with this - I find it easier if I remove every other cover for the track. The ball does come out easier that way but she also likes to chase the flashing ball around the house - I would recommend getting extra flashing balls as well. One time one cracked open and we had to glue it together. Unfortunately once the batteries die, you can't replace it. Sometimes a ball stays flashing even without no movement b/c metal coming in contact inside the ball. What I find works great is also to put ping pong balls on the track when I don't want flashing balls and it rolls very well in the track.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Two

customer_reviews.title: He liked at first, but...
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loved it on the first day but now he doesn’t seem very interested. The slots on the top are a little small and narrow and hard for him to reach in to bat the ball. When the ball isn’t in motion and flashing, it’s hard to find in there since its pale color blends into the white track.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for kittens!  My adult cats were unimpressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cool cat entertainment system; it goes together really easily and you can get extra lightballs for your cat's chasing pleasure. My fairly active10-year-old cats weren't interested in it, though, so I gave it to friends who have two kittens. It was an instant hit, and after two months, the kittens are still enthralled.
customer_reviews.author: Merganser

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Cat Toy
customer_reviews.text: This cat toy came in so many pieces that I gave up and handed to my husband. The cats looked at it and liked the ball going around the track but after that nothing. I don't know what their problem is, they don't like any toys I've bought them. So just because of that, I'm giving it five stars, if they had actually played with it, it would've gotten 10 stars.
customer_reviews.author: CDWB

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting track.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toy for 3 years now. Our boys played with it for a bit. We fostered many kittens and their moms for 2 years. Now we have our own kitten. She loves it just as much as our fosters did. The light in the ball no longer works, but it has been well loved! This is great for kittens, but they grow out of it around a year old.
customer_reviews.author: debbie campbell

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The ball wouldn’t light up unless you tap it hard and then only for a second. The ball wouldn’t keep moving no matter how fast we started. The tunnel pieces pop right off.
customer_reviews.author: knightreigner

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, not very practical in action
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, not very practical in action. My cat pulls it apart just to get to the ball creating a mess. Is kinda bulky and takes up just way too much space. Thought i could create my own design with tracks but turns out not really. After a well my cat was bored with it and now it's just another toy wasted in the corner of a room. He rather play with a balled up piece of paper
customer_reviews.author: JeNRG

customer_reviews.title: A piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: This thing is horrible. Hard to make it stay together. No instructions at all. No balls came with it. I just wasted my money and it wasn't that cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Colley

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with it at all!
customer_reviews.text: This came to me defective! One of the pieces didn't have the blue part on the white part correctly, and there is NO WAY to get it off! It is locked on! Since it came to me locked on incorrectly, it suggests to me that this product was returned by another customer, which means it was USED already! I'm not talking about the end caps, which didn't even COME with those (even though the directions show how to attach the end parts!), is another reason I'm sending this POS back!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: It did not work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought most of the Catit Design Super Roller Circuit and other items. We could never get the Roller Circuit to work - even when we added the red balls, etc. I was very disappointed! The difference in the low and high was not nearly enough. I will give it to charity. Muzzy
customer_reviews.author: Muzzy

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but no luck with my hair ball kitten
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but I think it’s best for kittens not 2 year kitty’s my cat watched me put it together then I was playing with it at first to keep her interested but once I left my kitty could careless I thought changing the track around different ways but no luck she couldn’t careless so I had to send back but if I thought I would get a kitten I would of kept ....
customer_reviews.author: jackie palmer

product_meta.title: Catit Design Senses Super Roller Circuit Toy for Cats
product_meta.description:
Size:8 inches x 9.5 inches x 9.5 inchesCatit Design Senses Super Roller Circuit takes fun and action to breathtakingly new heights. This large 8-piece circuit has alternating high and low sections with an enticing motion-activated illuminated ball the zips around inside, enticing cats to chase and swipe at it. There are large openings along the circuit that allow curious felines to safely reach in and touch the ball. It's the ultimate exercise stimulator for cats.

AMAZON.COM


 Catit Design Senses Super Roller Circuit takes fun and action to breathtakingly new heights. This large 8-piece circuit has alternating high and low sections with an enticing motion-activated illuminated ball the zips around inside, enticing cats to chase and swipe at it. There are large openings along the circuit that allow curious felines to safely reach in and touch the ball. It's the ultimate exercise stimulator for cats. 

Catit Senses A FULL LINE OF FUN FOR YOUR CAT!
The Catit Senses Line was designed to incorporate all of your cat’s senses while he or she plays. The products have the ability to be used alone or interconnect to build your cat a compact play center or an entire entertainment playground. Add as many Play Circuits or Speed Tracks to connect as many or as few Senses Centers as you wish. The Catit Senses toys are easy to assemble and disassemble allowing you to create a variety of play areas for your cat.

Targets different senses of your cat. Each of the toys targets different senses of your cat, but when combined it becomes a collection of innovative cat products designed to enrich a cat's life by stimulating all of his or her senses. Building your cat a complete Catit Senses entertainment center is even a great way to help occupy your cat when you might be away on a trip for a day or two!

The Catit Senses Circuits are the key components of any play set design. As you design your Senses playground try wrapping the play centers with Circuits, this provides additional stability for those times of rough play.

With the Catit Senses Line you are helping your cat develop physically and mentally. We use all of our senses every day and it is important for your cat to do the same. Exploring their senses will provide them with the ability to reach their full potential and live a long and healthy life. 


CATIT DESIGN SENSE TOYS

Catit Senses Play Circuit CATIT SENSES PLAY CIRCUIT
The Catit Design Senses Play Circuit incorporates sight, sound and touch and is specially designed to entice, engage and entertain a cat while appealing to his natural hunting instincts. 

Catit Design Senses Super Roller Circuit CATIT DESIGN SENSES SUPER ROLLER CIRCUIT
Catit Design Senses Super Roller Circuit takes fun and action to breathtakingly new heights. This large 8-piece circuit has alternating high and low sections with an enticing motion-activated illuminated ball the zips around inside, enticing cats to chase and swipe at it.

Catit Senses Grass Garden CATIT SENSES GRASS GARDEN
Not all cats are meant to go outside and explore the grounds around them. This is where the Catit Senses Grass Garden plays an important role in your cat’s life. The Grass Garden brings the outside world inside to your cat.

Catit Design Senses Comfort Zone Elevated Bed CATIT DESIGN SENSES COMFORT ZONE ELEVATED BED
Catit Design Senses Comfort Zone is excellent for stimulating and pampering cats of all ages. This unique product has a special therapeutic cushion that can be cooled to comfort or heal your cat. It's ideal for felines who need to chill out on a warm day or arthritic cats seeking a cool surface to ease inflammation.

Catit Senses Scratch Pad CATIT SENSES SCRATCH PAD
Catit Senses Scratch Pad Cats see and hear sights and sounds that are beyond our perception. They experience the world in ways we can only imagine with their unique sense of taste, touch and smell. Catit Design Senses products are made with your cat in mind and designed to appeal to all of your cat's senses.

Catit Senses Food Maze CATIT SENSES FOOD MAZE
The Catit Senses Food Maze is a sure way to feed your cat and stimulate its mind at the same time. Gone are the days where your cat doesn’t have to work for its food!

Catit Design Senses Massage Center CATIT DESIGN SENSES MASSAGE CENTER
After a hard day of napping, eating and playing, provide your cats with an oasis of calm and relaxation with the Catit Design Senses Massage Center. With a variety of sculpted textures and surfaces, it provides a cat with the ultimate pampering and massage experience

Catit Design Senses Speed Circuit CATIT DESIGN SENSES SPEED CIRCUIT
The Catit Senses Speed Circuit provides endless opportunities for your cat to chase around an illuminated ball and get all the exercise that it needs. The Speed Circuit sends your cat all around trying to get its paws on the ball and provides it with lots of energy.




CATIT FOUNTAINS, LITTER BOXES, AND ACCESSORIES
Catit Design SmartSift Sifting Cat Pan CATIT DESIGN SMARTSIFT SIFTING CAT PAN
Specially designed for Catit Design SmartSift, these biodegradable replacement liners make managing your cat's litter very convenient. Easy to install, the liners are designed to fit perfectly in the waste bin. They are very effective at preventing waste clumps from sticking to the waste bin's surface, making cleanups so much easier. 

Catit Design SmartSift Liner for Cat Pan with Drawer CATIT DESIGN SMARTSIFT LINER FOR CAT PAN WITH DRAWER
The Catit Design Fresh & Clear Drinking Fountain with Food Bowl responds to your pet's need for a continuous supply of fresh and clean drinking water. Re-circulating water with greater exposure to oxygen provides fresh-tasting, cool filtered water for pets with a multitude of health benefits.

Catit Design Catit Fresh & Clear Drinking Fountain CATIT FRESH & CLEAR DRINKING FOUNTAIN
Catit Design SmartSift makes scooping by hand a thing of the past. The innovative Catit SmartSift features a simple, yet practical Pull-and-Refresh system that makes litter maintenance so much easier than using a scoop.

Catit Design Catit Fresh & Clear Drinking Fountain Replacement filter 3 pack CATIT DESIGN CATIT FRESH & CLEAR DRINKING FOUNTAINREPLACEMENT FILTER 3 PACK
The Replacement Purifying Filter is for use with the Catit Design Fresh & Clear Drinking Fountain with food bowl. This dual-function replaceable filter helps to collect debris, food and sediment. 

Catit Design Senses Illuminated Ball - 2-Pack CATIT DESIGN SENSES ILLUMINATED BALL - 2-PACK
The Catit Design Senses Illuminated Ball is a package of two replacement balls that work with the Catit Design Senses Speed Circuit or Catit Design Senses Play Circuit. The Catit Circuit Line appeals to your cat's senses in order to increase activity and stimulate its mind.

Hagen Catit Design Home 3-in-1 Scratcher HAGEN CATIT DESIGN HOME 3-IN-1 SCRATCHER
Catit Design 3-in-1 Scratcher is a versatile bed/scratcher/toy combo that serves as a unique and convenient activity center. It has a comfortable resting spot with a central scratcher for your cat to enjoy.

Catit Design Senses Fountain with Water Softening Cartridge CATIT DESIGN SENSES FOUNTAIN WITH WATER SOFTENING CARTRIDGE
Catit Design Senses Drinking Fountain (replaces 55600) provides your cat with a continuous indoor source of cool, fresh-tasting, filtered water that encourages your pet to drink more. Drinking more water helps ensure proper kidney function, helping to prevent crystal formation that can lead to urinary diseases.

Catit Design Senses Replacement Water Filtering Cartridge, 2-Pack CATIT DESIGN SENSES REPLACEMENT WATER FILTERING CARTRIDGE, 2-PACK
Catit Design Senses Water Softening Filter softens hard water by removing the magnesium and calcium present in tap water. These minerals can accumulate in your pet's lower urinary tract and lead to urinary tract diseases, which is a common health issue for cats.


Catit Fresh & Clear Small Drinking Fountain CATIT FRESH & CLEAR SMALL DRINKING FOUNTAIN
Encouraging your cat to drink more water helps prevent crystal formation that can lead to urinary diseases. Because the body uses water continuously, your pet's supply of water must be constant. The Catit Design Fresh & Clear Drinking Fountain provides an indoor source of moving water that will encourage your pet to drink more.

Catit Fresh and Clear Fountain Replacement Cartridges CATIT FRESH AND CLEAR FOUNTAIN REPLACEMENT CARTRIDGES
Replacement filters for the Catit Small Drinking Fountain. Comes in a pack of 3.

Provide a better quality of living for your pet with Catit
